decks.notes: The deck focuses on using efficient creatures like Noble Hierarch, Knight of the Reliquary, and Tarmogoyf to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. It also includes disruptive elements like Vendilion Clique and Sower of Temptation to control the board. The deck's mana base allows for consistent mana development and the ability to disrupt opponent's lands with Wasteland. The inclusion of powerful spells like Swords to Plowshares, Force of Will, and Brainstorm help maintain tempo and control the game. The deck also features a small equipment package with Stoneforge Mystic fetching Sword of Fire and Ice and Umezawa's Jitte to further enhance its aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on aggressively playing Merfolk creatures to quickly overwhelm opponents. By utilizing cards like Coralhelm Commander and Merrow Reejerey, the deck can generate a lot of tempo and put pressure on the opponent early on. Key cards like Lord of Atlantis and Kira, Great Glass-Spinner help to protect the board and maintain the advantage. With disruptive elements like Cursecatcher and Sower of Temptation, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan while still delivering a powerful beatdown strategy. Overall, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to produce a large amount of mana with High Tide and Candelabra of Tawnos, allowing the player to go off with a big Time Spiral to draw additional cards and generate even more mana. The deck includes various cantrips and card draw spells to find combo pieces quickly, as well as counterspells to protect the combo. Cunning Wish is included for toolbox options, while Turnabout and Meditate help to further increase the mana output. Blue Sun's Zenith and Intuition provide alternative win conditions and additional card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Tombstalker and Tarmogoyf. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Snuff Out and Engineered Explosives, while also maintaining card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Sylvan Library. The deck utilizes a mix of blue, black, and green cards to create a versatile and adaptable strategy that can handle a variety of threats in the Legacy format.

This Maverick Aggro deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Knight of the Reliquary and Noble Hierarch, while utilizing Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order to search for key creatures like Progenitus and Rafiq of the Many for powerful finishes. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Qasali Pridemage and Swords to Plowshares to control the board. With a mix of efficient creatures, powerful spells, and versatile equipment, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with aggressive strategies while maintaining board presence and adaptability.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through rituals and mana accelerants like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, while also using card selection and hand disruption to protect the combo. The goal is to assemble the necessary cards to cast Ad Nauseam or Infernal Tutor to find Tendrils of Agony, which can be used to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn, overwhelming the opponent with an intricate series of spells that culminate in a devastating storm count.

This deck focuses on using Counterbalance and Sensei's Divining Top to control the opponent's spells, while also generating Thopter tokens with Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek. The deck includes various tutors and counterspells to maintain board control and protect key pieces. Jace, the Mind Sculptor provides card advantage and additional control options. The inclusion of Engineered Explosives, Vedalken Shackles, and Moat further solidify the deck's ability to deal with a variety of threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control through cards like Vindicate, Thoughtseize, and Hymn to Tourach, while also using disruptive creatures like Dark Confidant and Knight of the Reliquary. The deck also utilizes removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Gerrard's Verdict to deal with threats. The mana base includes lands that can both fix mana and disrupt the opponent's mana, creating advantages for the pilot. The deck's card advantage engine is fueled by Dark Confidant and Sensei's Divining Top, allowing for consistent and powerful plays.

The main idea behind this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards using dredge abilities and various discard effects in order to trigger powerful graveyard synergies like Bridge from Below. By utilizing cards like Careful Study and Breakthrough to fill the graveyard, the deck aims to reanimate high impact creatures like Angel of Despair and Flame-Kin Zealot using Dread Return. The strategy revolves around quickly and efficiently assembling combos that can overwhelm the opponent while leveraging the graveyard as a resource.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Kird Ape, Tarmogoyf, and Wild Nacatl combined with efficient removal spells and burn spells. It also utilises creature-based utility with Qasali Pridemage and Knight of the Reliquary, as well as card advantage and equipment with Stoneforge Mystic. The mana base is optimized for consistent access to all colors needed for spells and creatures. The overall strategy is to apply early pressure, control the board with removal, and improve its creatures with equipment to win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing cheap and efficient artifact creatures like Signal Pest, Ornithopter, and Memnite to quickly establish a threatening board presence. The deck also prioritizes artifact synergies, with cards like Master of Etherium and Cranial Plating boosting the power and toughness of creatures. Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas provides card advantage and additional artifact support, while Mox Opal helps ramp out threats quickly. With a mix of cheap creatures and powerful equipment, this deck aims to win the game quickly through overwhelming aggression.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by using low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells. By efficiently using resources like lands and burn spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The creatures like Goblin Guide and Figure of Destiny provide early pressure, while spells like Rift Bolt and Price of Progress can deal direct damage to the opponent. The ultimate goal is to reduce the opponent's life total to zero as quickly as possible, before they can mount a defense.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy centered around Goblin creatures. By utilizing cards like Goblin Lackey to cheat out creatures early, along with tribal synergies from cards like Goblin Warchief and Goblin Chieftain, the deck aims to flood the board with powerful Goblin creatures and quickly deal damage to the opponent. With efficient spells like Goblin Piledriver and Gempalm Incinerator, along with support from Aether Vial for free creature casts, this deck is designed to be explosive and put the opponent on the back foot from the start.
